result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin M Hathaway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property fr. Person [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class G felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence with the following condition to be met:  follow all terms and conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay appropriate costs.  Pay costs, fees,  assessments and supervision fees.  DOC to collect  while on probation.  
If revoked, to be paid from 25% of prison funds and on Extended Supervision. 
 To convert to a civil judgment that is nondischargeable in bankruptcy.
Obtain HSED/GED.  Seek and maintain employment and/or school.  Job/vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with victim Lamont W. or codefendant Montrell D.

Cognitive thinking therapy.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
To be served as follows:  60 days in HOC.  Huber for work. Good time to apply.  Report date is 6/25/2014.  
Balance of 60 days STAYED:  to be used at the discretion of the PO agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin M Hathaway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Calvin M Hathaway in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Deann L Heard appeared for Kimberly Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk Filed with the court:  Letters in support of the defendant.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Patrice W.
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be 4 years consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 2 years with credit for 6 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 2 years on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.    The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant. 
The Court STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 2.5 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION OR EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- no controlled substances or alcohol
- AODA assessment and treatment with random urine screens
- no contact with victim, Lamont W or co-defendant Montrell D.
- obtain HSED/GED
- restitution is set at zero
- seek and maintain employment and/or school
- job/vocational training
- cognitive thinking therapy
- provide a DNA sample and pay appropriate costs
- serve 4 months conditions time: 60 days in the HOC with huber for work and 60 days imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the PO agent.  Good time to apply.  Defendant report date is 6-26-2014 at 5:00 pm.
- pay costs, fees and assessments and supervision fees to be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court costs to be paid while on probation to convert to a civil judgement that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.  If defendant serves his sentence in the WPS, costs to be paid from 25% of his prison funds and on extended supervision to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.
Filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Sentencing Referral Form, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Appeal rights given.
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class G felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence with the following conditions to be met:
- follow all terms and conditions of probation
- follow all terms and conditions of PO agent
- pay all sums surcharge with no reduction to civil judgment
- no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed. rn

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered case continued for sentencing and that all terms and conditions of bail continue.  Case is adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 6/19/14 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Calvin M Hathaway in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, charging defendant as follows:
Attempt Theft From Person, Party to a Crime, an attempt to commit a Class G Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. sections 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e), 939.50(3)(g), 939.32 and 939.05.

Defendant Calvin M Hathaway in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State received additional information which may affect offer made.  Court granted request and ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea before Branch 20.  Justice Point report received; defendant compliant. Court ordered all terms and conditions to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from Justice Point, received and filed.  Defendant compliant. rn

Defendant Calvin M Hathaway in court with attorney Heather Johnson.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court granted request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Calvin M Hathaway in court with attorney Heather Johnson.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn  ADA Schoepp in trial.  Defense counsel advised that negotiations continue and requested another scheduling date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Calvin M Hathaway in court with attorney Heather Johnson.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Report dated 1/14/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lamont W or Co-Defendant Montrell Doss

Defendant Calvin M Hathaway in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Calvin M Hathaway in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
